QuwN5crs5CJ4uzCpDp6bwA.text: The burgers here are simply the best in London. Service was fast and friendly.

uutR38ItXAdmrFuPZUZF1w.text: Hmm let's start with the good shall we1) Although my burger was slightly past medium it was still juicy 2) The Oreo milkshakes were the perfect consistency, not so thick that you couldn't get it through a straw not so cold it gave you brain freeze. Perfect!3) Nice soft bun that didn't require extensive surgery (on the bun not me!) to get it in one mouthful. Hate those ciabatta monstrosities that rip your mouth to shreds. The not so good...1) Short menu. The fancyiest burger has just 3 toppings bacon, cheese and Byron sauce. I didn't order this because it sounded like a saltfest (bacon and capers in the sauce) but in retrospect that's exactly what my burger need. More seasoning and more sauce. My cheesburger just tasted of meat, tomato and lettuce as the mature cheddar wasn't bring much to the party and in a country where tomatoes taste of water that's not enough. I ended up throwing on all the condiments on the table (mustard, chili sauce, ketchup) in a desperate bid to make it taste of something2) The courgette fries. These got slightly too greasy halfway through the bowl. I felt a bit sick after eating these. Stick to regular.So where would I put Byron in the league table of chain burger places? Better that the travesty that is Fine Burger not as good as GBK. Byron-it's OK!

R830K0McOUVql2mUmkTNbw.text: Thank goodness Byron has opened up in Islington - finally a proper, tasty burger in the area! Used to go to The Diner but was always a bit disappointed with them - now I will be at Byron instead, having a juicy, cooked-to-order burger with some amazing courgette fries. This place rocks, even if the decor is a bit too unfinished for my taste (the ceiling joists are exposed, making it look like you're eating in a building site). Our party of 6 was seated quickly and service was friendly (perhaps even overly friendly for England?) Jugs of tap water get them even more bonus points. Next time I'm trying the oreo milkshake.

1yPcoPJ0OD9eXUOMBWtxxg.text: I've been to this Byron many, many times. As I'm from Los Angeles, home of In N' Out, I definitely know a good burger when I taste one. I love going to Byron for a quick bite. The beef is succulent, and the slice of pickle gives it that American feel. The shakes are great and most of the time the staff are very friendly and make sure you're happy with the meal.

NkOgLAWbn2k7AZ9mtQ3ixg.text: It was a cold dark night and I craved some meat. I have also been reading about this place since what feels like new restaurant chain opening time began and thought its time to see what the fuss was about. I was impressed. I had a full on cheeseburger, loaded with jack cheese and the hand cut fries and a gingerbeer. Yes I have become that rock and roll these days. My beloved had the same cheeseburger, but because she wanted a girly version she had the skinny one which had no bun but a rather nice salad which I ate lots of too. It had a great variety of leaves that included peppery ones and ones that had little red streaks on so it didn't end up being oily green stuff. The dressing was sharp and tangy too. She did have some fries so we wouldn't end up ordering more. Or the age old thing that happens when you eat with a girl - they say they don't want chips and then they end up eating all of yours. Then the next day complain that they are putting on weight. OK before I get flame grilled alive more than the burgers, I must add that my beloved isn't one of those those ladies! The food in there is so moorish and lovely that you will find yourself reluctant to share. Burger food is about being slightly gluttonous anyway. The meat in the burgers was lean yet really flavourful and juicy. The cheese had the right melty balance with the cheese that didn't feel like you were swallowing grease nor would be likely to be sweating meat and cheese for the next week. I love burgers but I don't eat them often as I know they aren't the healthiest things on the planet but sometimes when you want to feel you are being slapped on the back by a gruff lumberjack, nothing does this better than a burger. A good one at that. The service in there was good, staff attentive but not irritating. The menu in Byron is simple but I am glad they keep it that way. I think it's important (especially where burgers are concerned) to keep it simple and to focus on making a really good base product. Every time I want a good burger my choice shall be Byron. I also loved the exposed brickwork and deliberately mismatched chairs. It had a very own industrial chic about it and food was prompt. If you haven't gone already then check it out! It doesn't burn a hole in your pocket and you leave feeling satisfied in having eaten naughty but very nice food.

mEjXnGVU-UGYmJx1Ix3tEw.text: Excellent hamburger restaurant with some healthy options thrown in. The quality of the meat is exceptionally good. Also a good range of soft drinks including my favourite root beer.Shame abouit the "trendy" warehouse vibe setting which fails to impress. Still the staff are friendly and the service is first class.

_lO6n5-ZWsUxkvNaMKm6Fg.text: I had heard many differences of opinion regarding the Byron burger chain, and I finally got a chance to see for myself.  I ordered from the take away menu, which has limited options when compared to the full menu.  When I saw the Portobello mushroom burger with goat cheese and other yummy ingredients, I could look no further.  It is not common at a burger place to find such a decadent option.  I noticed as I came in the different french fry options, and when I saw the hand cut, skin on, option, there was no turning back. After ordering they had a couple of chairs that you could sit in and wait for your food as the entrance is very tiny when coming in, and I felt like I was in the way of everyone.  Be sure to ask for ketchup when you order take out as they don't automatically pack it.  Even though the place was crowded and the servers were running around like chickens with their heads cut off, they were all very friendly.  I had a ginger beer as I was waiting, and it was fantastic. I wish I remembered the brand name.  They packed all the food nicely into a easy to carry paper bag, which I quickly took home and unwrapped.  Everything was still hot and fresh when I started to eat, and it was very tasty.  I would definitely go back for the Portobello.  Good mushroom burgers are hard to find.  The fries were also exactly what I was hoping for.

a8KVDVi92Bv6VIS7mPCSAA.text: As I always complain about, where is the 1/2 star option, cause this would be a 3.5 'er.  I gave it the push to four because, they do what they do very well.  My wife and I initially decided to eat here - not knowing what food they serve - cause the exterior treatment of the building looked so cool.It's your basic burgers and fries here, but done up right.  I had the Byron with the special spicy BBQ sauce (extra charge...grrr, thus 3.5 stars), thin fries, and a coke.All phases = terrific.  £12.25 for the above seems neither cheap, nor expensive, so I guess they have their price point and their market pegged.  I'll be back.

IE8JT0Y4ppbGDd1q7O8Pqw.text: i came here really late last night as it was one of the only things around that was open.  i don't eat burgers, but i do love a veg burger.  unfortunately the one here was a portobello mushroom burger rather than a veg patty, so i opted for a feta and squash salad instead.  my friend got the welsh rarebit after much convincing, b/c she had never had one before.  the waiter told her it was really good, so she was persuaded.  we also got the fried courgettes to share.  we waited about 15 minutes while everyone around us got their food.  they must have been roasting the squash right then and there.  when our food arrived, they brought her a hamburger instead, but she was too hungry by then that she ate it anyway.  my salad was like 5 pcs of squash w/ a lot of feta on a bed of greens, undressed.  i proceeded to pour the dressing over my salad only to find out it was just olive oil.  how hard is it to find a good salad in this country?  it certainly wasn't worth the 8.50 gbp.

KasDY_FQPfSQcMEsDw9jtw.text: This was a pretty good burger joint, considering that it is in the UK. I was surprised at how much it resembled a quality American burger like the kind I can get back home. The fries were average, but the burger itself was amazing. The bun was soft. while the meat was high-quality. The service was prompt and attentive, which is was I have come to expect in this day and age. I would come back if I am ever in the Islington/Angel area again.

Gydagic7pu55zZxQJhepdQ.text: Great venue for proper american burgers, and none of that bogus preservative filled meat substitute that you find at the main-stream chains. My vote would be - go for the burgers - and have a Byron, and add Jalpenos or a portabello mushroom. If I wasn't leaving so early tomorrow morning, I'd have one for breakfast! A.

gWjoXWFCe_YmqyH0Qy_tLg.text: Great burger, chips and onions rings! I went for the blue cheese burger, which came with nice fresh salad and chunky gherkin. We were served quickly, and the restaurant was packed. Would of been a 5* rating, but ordered aioli to go with the onion rings and it wasn't up to the same standard as the rest of the meal!

cDYn22o4BVW2Ls_ZqgwJDA.text: I know there are a lot of hamburger chains in London but this one is number one! Firstly it's near home so I save time taking away while going out or on my way back. Secondly the veggie burger here is the best veggie I've eaten. I'm not vegetarian, so hamburger without meat is just as salad with bread so usually after I tried it I don't purchase it again. But this one is different. I don't know why maybe it's the goat cheese or the red pepper but I like it a lot. Not as much as the double one but pretty close.

KjlT1ABezybHZTNB_sOJdQ.text: Love Byron burgers!  Get the double skinny with courgette fries all the time!!

vCvzO5jwge3ypaTv9t8-yA.text: This lot will be giving many of the other burger joints a run for their money. Incredible burgers done medium so still pinky in the centre - exactly as they should be. The skin on chips were just perfect and hopefully slightly healthier than the skinnies also on offer. Staff were very sussed and the Islington branch (I believe another branch is planned for Covent Garden) is wonderfully de-constructed/industrial/construction-in-progress in terms of it's decor. With such a fab offering I suggest they get that upper floor sorted - to accommodate the willing punters.

kCNcFz3dt2xsCSv0OGBjew.text: Byron Hamburgers have come up with the nifty idea of taking over the old, not particularly special Hamburger Union restaurant and transforming it into a great place to eat. The interior is, at this stage, so under-developed that I wasn't quite sure if they haven't actually finished. Everywhere is bare brick walls, timber and "toilets upstairs" scribbled on the way in felt-tip pen. However, the kitchen is gleaming new and appears to be working well. The hamburgers themselves were great: flavoursome and fresh without being overladen. The sides (hand-cut skin on chips and onion rings) were a perfect compliment. I also went for a chocolate malt which was just the right side of thick and served as an awesome starter, accompaniment and desert. I will definitely keep coming back as long as they keep serving burgers this good.

SJNe0T3E5Gx82qWZ8OQeZw.text: Sometimes, like Joni Mitchell sang, you don't know what you've got until it's gone. And that's very much the case with a Byron burger, which disappeared rather quickly after it arrived at my table. And while I'm sure I've had better burgers, I'll be darned if I can remember them. But I do remember Byron's burger - and every meat patty between a bun since just hasn't measured up. Yes, the menu isn't exactly extensive. But this is a burger joint, not The Ivy. Frankly, I'd be a bit worried if they were pushing an inventive scallop dish as a starter. It's always a sign of confidence if you don't get a great deal of choice, and there's more than enough options with extra toppings to keep you happy. The burgers themselves are deceptively filling - a decent size yet a challenge to you when you reach the last couple of mouthfuls. Plus the meat is tender and pink in the middle and the grilling is just right. The courgette fries are also a clever and utterly delicious addition to a meal and much more moreish than the standard fries. You'll be plotting how to make them at home, and failing. And this is without mentioning the huge onion rings. A few criticisms: they forget the extra bacon in my friend's burger, but the staff were very quick, friendly helpful and apologetic and fixed this quickly. Plus I'm not entirely sure if I'm keen on the 'half-renovated-before-the-builders-took-an-extended-tea-break' is quite my thing. But there's no arguing with the quality of burgers, the speed of service, the friendly staff and the price. Maybe I'll find a better burger in London over the coming months, but it'll have to go a long way to top Byron.

tLtzFnMfNNxeNbHbWVZAWw.text: ehhhh... the burgers look delicious, the place looks cool from the inside, but yet it kinda fails to delivery. The fries were just alright and the meat patties I though were not good, but I would account that to the general low quality of beef in the UK (especially the minced beef). The staff however is really friendly and the atmosphere is good, or shall I say cool, with its shabby chic look.

uEPQbjvuSMjLOaLYspHffQ.text: I know its a burger chain but I thought it was good.  The sides were tasty and so was the burger.  Highly recommended with egg and avocado.  The best thing is its reasonably priced.

QhgLyRWrCj1m71MxQfQx-w.text: Delicious and fun. Have to sit close to people but hey that's the price of a good burger these days.

ZA7IuUoUvXNqyJxx0j4VBQ.text: Went here last weekend with an English friend I met back home in the States, so we're very particular about our burgers. I was pleasantly surprised - I had been craving a medium rare, bloody burger and fries! I'm happy with how they cooked it, and also happy that they had monterrey jack cheese since I can't seem to find that here. The fries were great, none of this 'chip' nonsense. Left off the last star because I think they could have a few more options for burgers. Or maybe that can be left to us Americans!

cUedBqUQVP_kimk_wbezLg.text: This is a decent burger place with quick and friendly service.  Just be careful--I ordered my burger medium rare and it came very rare.  Didn't sample the fries or onion rings, so the jury is still out on the full indulgence.

dgxQ-BOoz0NGc7XNCw4Vlg.text: Really really really good burgers - it's all they are promisnig and they deliver in spades. VERY good

iX-wB6kM3d9SaEN70fc6ww.text: I've been to this Byron many, many times. As I'm from Los Angeles, home of In N' Out, I definitely know a good burger when I taste one. I love going to Byron for a quick bite. The beef is succulent, and the slice of pickle gives it that American feel. The shakes are great and most of the time the staff are very friendly and make sure you're happy with the meal.

photos.caption: Photo of Byron - London, United Kingdom

S2c0VhjJ-e0A6mbHVmrULA.text: Attention London!  BYRON is how you do a burger right, American style!!  This place has is all starting with amazing burgers cooked to a perfect medium rare (any more done and you might as well be eating a hockey puck, I'm talking to you GBK).  Perfect amount of toppings to burger ratio, CRISPY bacon (not the thick fatty stuff served around London) and real BBQ sauce.  I should also mention the super yummy lightly battered onion rings and hand cut fries are not to be missed. This location is great as well with a cool minimal design and extremely friendly staff.  Will be back very soon and very often and recommend you check it out too!

_Eibvdkm2mGZdUv51pvuWA.text: Great place and location on Upper Street. It is opposite the Business Design Centre, and is the latest branch of Bryon (replaces Hamburger Union on Upper Street). David, manager (centre of photos), mentioned that they are rolling out other branches across London - including Covent Garden. I was impressed by the way things were running, given that they had only been open for 3days. All staff very friendly and helpful, especially our waitress Adriana,the manager David and the chefs. Loved the stripped back, almost rustic, look; when you look down from first floor you can see to joists. Cheeseburger with Gruyere cheese was yummy and not greasy like some other burger joints (eg. Fine Burger Co.). Loved the Courgette Fries - they come hot with a nice crispy semolina batter coating. Oreo Cookie milkshake is amazing, and just right composition. Enjoyed the relaxed atmosphere and will be going back again.

photos.caption: Photo of Byron - London, United Kingdom
Photo of Byron - London, United Kingdom
Photo of Byron - London, United Kingdom

kbo7pCMrXwHE3wTUbSX_4g.text: They had really good burgers and a great view out the window.It was right near a really  famous theater

QlYxYTCUnJJ_J98kPRnU6w.text: As always, tasty burgers, lovely sides, funky waiters, and palatable bill !!!

z_5Ha1wsfgojGdzrUvivog.text: I've just eaten my first ever hamburger. Yup, Byon popped this meaty cherry, what a shame hey?It wasn't bad, actually I had a lovely evening. The staff were super friendly and helpful, but considering this is part of the Pizza express group I'm not surprised by that. They had nice chips, a wonderful blue cheese sauce that could have done with some more blue cheese in it, but it was still okay. It's not the worst choice of dining destination, it's just not my first.It's a perfect spot for a pre-cinema meal, which is what it was for me.

m0GiNHUH3AG2L2kOaQmLCA.text: Solid 4 star. I love the beer selection here. Burgers decent. Not out of this world but better than the average. I always have mac cheese here - a reason to come back. Not the cheapest burger you'll ever eat... They have Cloud wifi which I find annoying because of registration requirement. What's wrong with a straight up password?!

photos.caption: Photo of Byron - London, United Kingdom. My beer!

SvaeL-ITF7eg10SmgN4Y3g.text: Great burgers. Good chips. Interesting 'building site chic' decor. Great service from various convivial australians.  You cant really argue with this place. Unpretentious, efficient, relatively cheap. It's not haute cuisine.  But it's yummy all the same.

BZHBA-aIQoV2KC--5KVQLQ.text: I didn't 'mind' Hamburger Union but wow, BYRON is Islington is a fantastic replacement! Firstly I LOVE the decor - amazing. Distressed exterior, raw pipework inside...the entire feel is very raw but it works and is especially beautiful at night. Anyway - we couldn't eat in tonight as we were both exhausted from a day with the kids so I called up and ordered a takeaway (collection only). Our food was excellent. My skinny fries were great, really full of flavour and my wife's skin on chips were even better. Our cheeseburgers were just perfect - soft bun, great meat. I wolfed mine down in seconds! To top it off our milkshakes were off the hook - my OREO cookie one fantastic. Byron works well because it delivers simple simple food but with lots of flavour and no fuss. It's exactly what you want from an honest burger place but goes that little bit further to make you want to come back. My only tiny tiny tiny gripe (which may not apply to most people) is that our burgers were very much medium / rare - i.e. chargrilled on the outside, pink inside. Whilst I LOVE my burgers like this my wife didn't like the rawness so much - so if your'e not a fan of raw meat then please make sure you ask for a well done version! Can't wait to go back - well done BYRON!

photos.caption: Photo of Byron - London, United Kingdom. I LOVE what they've done with the outside of Byron

URpEF1uoM5n_gc9X-AHVMg.text: I think the burger was perfect, i had a chicken burger the bun was soft and the chicken was perfectly grilled i would definitely go there again the design i weird though

p_snLKOZC8tlPVfS9I_uqg.text: I've been careful, living in London, to stay away from those foods of which I have high standards for from places that do them too well.  Being from the Bay Area, where burgers come from grass fed, free range stock and cooked just right (900 Grayson I miss you), I didn't exect much at Byron's.  Well, they haven't surpassed my faves, but they did come close.  Light and pleasant artisan bun, hearty bacon, and a patty that was flavorful,  deliciously pink medium and a crunchy crust to the meat cooked on a very hot grill, it's a damn fine burger.  The thick cut fries, typically my go-to side, were surprisingly rather bland, but their shoestring fries were just right. Bonus points for the pickle.I enjoy their gritty but trendy decor, although maybe they went a little too far on the exposed wiring and plumbing. The main deterrants to this place are how busy it gets and the extravagant prices.  A 12 to 13 pound bill for a burger and fries just seems wrong to me, where in the (also expensive) Bay Area you'd be getting a beer with a high quality burger for the same or lower price.

yrQo8_a-byx3MJ_aT8KVRg.text: Visiting from the States, back in August 2013. Unfortunately I cannot recall of the details of the visit, however, I know that I really enjoyed this place. I was staying at the Hilton which is  across the street. I was dead set on not having a burger while in London but I'm glad I did! In area that really appeals to everyone's palette, Byron is perfect if you want an American style burger. I like my hamburger medium and It was received more more medium rare...it was not that big of a deal for me so I didn't feel the need to send it back. Fries and dessert were both really good as well. If you are in the Angel area and you want a great burger this place won't disappoint. Service was great also!

pFoNl7UBDDnBzrQyz41Zaw.text: Yeah it was a burger.And it was just ok. But it shouldn't be just ok for the price.But the staff was friendly. And I bumped my head on a low ceiling when coming down the stairs from the bathroom. So learn from my mistake of not heeding the warning they posted on said beam.

3qItirs-3c-sg7aQ6yXtSQ.text: As a very infrequent meat eater, I truly savor the times when my meaty boyfriend can convince me to take a walk on the carnivorous side. I have to say I was a bit disappointed in Byron.  I figured since it has multiple big, and hopping locations, it must be pretty good, but it fell a bit shy of that for me.Mostly my problem was with the rare-ness of the burger.  I like a rare steak, but for me, a burger shouldn't be red.  A little light pink is fine, but this was just too much.  Through the whole meal I couldn't help thinking "I hope they practice proper refrigeration and meat-handling back there."  If you don't enjoy really enjoy rare ground meat, I would suggest ordering "not as rare as usual, please."  And for me the decor was also a little underdone (pun intended).  I understand the distressed look, but this place seriously looks like it's still under construction.  I was wondering when some plaster dust was going to fall from the exposed ceiling and sprinkle my chips!  Take a weekend, and give this place a polish, please!Will I be going back?  I've been to Byron in Islington and Soho, and I think that's enough overpriced, undercooked burgers for me.

omYuq-EWw6v0K69HLUUcwQ.text: The Byron chain has expanded to Islington.  The restaurant's new digs was formerly a Hamburger + so you would think that the conversion would have been a snap.  Nope.  The Byron crew decided to completely gut the place, giving it a 1990's deconstructed office building feel.  I ordered a burger with blue cheese and waited for it while sipping on a Brooklyn Lager.  Our waiter kept an eye on us and made sure we content.  The food isn't fast, but the 20 minute wait isn't excessively long.  The burger arrived on a huge plate with a pickle spear on the side (awesome).  It was cooked a perfect medium with a nice streak of pink in the middle, which was a nice change of pace from the usual overcooked rubber patties I am often served.  The bun is the perfect size and doesn't overwhelm the beef with too much bread.  At one point I commented on the complete silence that had fallen over the table and my husband said, "I can truly say I am just enjoying my food."  I ordered french fries instead of the thicker chips and they were nice and crispy.  My husband went with the courgette fries and I have to say, unless you hate courgettes, order them.  They are served with a crisp batter and a nice moist (but not soggy) middle.  There isn't a lot of veg taste to them and they certainly aren't any healthier than the chips, but they're a delicious change from the usual.  Along with the usual ketchup and mayo that you always find on the tables of burger joints, there is French's mustard, Coleman's mustard and Cholula, which I appreciated.  All in all, Byron served up a great burger, amazing courgette fries and service that made me give a tip that was larger than usual.

zM2fXly3vjrK0CKLwGanrg.text: No, you're not entering a construction zone...you're entering the ironic Americana oasis that is apparently Byron Islington. I'm a fan of Byron burgers, and thank god something replaced that torture chamber formerly known as Hamburger +, but it takes me a little while to accept this location. We're not in Shoreditch... let's just call it a slow burn. But they've been reading my Dream Diary and took my advice. If they like it, then they better put an (onion) ring on it. And they have... so now I'm incapable of resisting the hipster waitstaff who look like misplaced All Saints workers. If you can tell if any of this review is more compliment or insult then you're more skilled than most. Personally, I try not to think too much about it because when I do, I get lost in the unfinished ceiling beams and bathroom faucets that are only there for show....honestly....what a-hole thought to make fake faucet handles that are "for looks" next to the top one that's there "for function"it's a sink, not a concept.

YkFG96cylTFFNml1zTsSPw.text: Best American burgers you are gonna get in London! Love the Byron burger with green chiles. Hearty with Fire

LJ4_xliTwlrYU817jarz7w.text: OK - the ambiance?  Urban shabbiness taken beyond extreme and well into uncomfortable.  We had to change wobbly tables three times before we found one that was going to safely hold up the burger plates we planned on ordering.The friendly waiter seemed almost embarrassed by the furniture as he helped us try the tables out.  No one coming in after us wanted to sit at them them either.  There's a design center right across the street Byron - maybe you need a consultation?Now for the food ... between the four of us we had the regular cheeseburger, the Byron burger, the veggie burger, and a chicken Caesar salad, as well as splitting a order of onion rings.All of it was good - not the best we've ever had, but good.  The meat was juicy & not overcooked at medium and the buns were soft & not at all stale (a common shortcoming at UK burger joints).  The veggie burger was a flavorful portobello mushroom topped with spinach, roasted red pepper and goat's cheese.  The onion rings were quite good - lightly battered and not too greasy.  And the salad was not a red-headed stepchild - the chicken was freshly grilled and well marinated.The burgers are average priced if you consider a seven dollar burger in the states is the same as a seven pound burger here, but the sides and soft drinks are well over-priced.  Before tip, burgers and drinks for the four of us (remember, just the one side) totaled over forty-five pounds.

k2maO3urUHw6lRE8pFXuaQ.text: Not enough veggie options available I'm afraid, so I can't compliment this place on it's funky interior or its awesome fries. 'But you're a vegetarian, why would you want to eat burgers?' I hear you cry. Well actually I love a good veggie burger, and this place doesn't do them. OK it has gone for the unimaginative 'mushroom in a bap' option, but I certainly wouldn't want to pay 7 quid for a mushroom sandwich. Is it really that hard to make burger patties without meat, just in addition to the no-doubt staggeringly good meat menu? (no). Then they have no excuse not to serve them. I preferred it when it was Hamburger Union! Shame, as their tiling and shopfront are really awesome. Two stars for that.

VeU4oWAL7tZRYEgqG88Y5A.text: The food here is so, so good. I had the cheese burger, fries and vanilla milkshake. The milkshakes here is like diabetes in a glass. amazing. not for the faint hearted. literally the thickest shake in LONDON!!

r1GYPQdNekxbWmDujTsaRA.text: We seem to be living in burger age..So many burger/diner places... But nothing at all wrong with plain Jane but fresh food, especially when delivered with superb service. I had a veggie burger (mushroom and goat cheese), my friend had a standard beef burger. Both were gorgeous, flavoursome & juicy!

xqxJJj-Z_Qspm9AcCv3e1A.text: I'm a massive fan of this chain and loved their special the flaming iceberg.The burger itself was a good mix of hot (Jalapeños and hot sauce) with cool (ranch dressing and lettuce). Also a lot of credit needs to go to Byron for their great range of craft beer on offer.

WKkgHjw9R6hHpKlHKD8Zvg.text: Byron offers good-quality burgers, and I must say that unlike gbk, the portions make for less clumsy consumption. I had a classic burger. The burger pattie was cooked to perfection, and the meat quality was great.The fries are well salted and nice and crispy. The courgette fries looked curiously healthy on the menu, but after I got an order of those babies, I realised that the were batter-fried. So, yeah, that was the end of healthy fries. Portions of sides are considerable.The exposed brick and tile look is cool, but somewhat overdone. Ok, no worries. But the waiters running up and down the stairs with the food was blocking the stairway most of the time. I'd definitely go back to try the other

_C2VP0IbZwAxUVWoelhKsg.text: Wow Byron... you're so... so... distressed. So urban-chic. So industrial-shab. If I hadn't watched workers slave away this time last year actually destroying the ins and outs of this building - exposing beams, sanding off just enough paint, breaking tiles and applying, then distressing the name "Byron" on the outside of the building I might have actually bought it... Instead I just bought a burger. A damn good burger. It involved spicy BBQ sauce, pepper jack cheese and was cooked to perfection. I've also recently indulged in a beetroot salad and an Oreo milkshake that literally blew my mind when it arrived in a milkshake cup with the extra on the side. So really Byron, your burgers, sides, salads and milkshakes bring the boys to the yard. Why are you spending time and money posing as anything but a great local burger joint?

photos.caption: Photo of Byron - London, United Kingdom
Photo of Byron - London, United Kingdom

SkvlzhME-WJFyBxxYlzeXg.text: I'm giving Byron an A-OK. I don't tend to crave burgers in the UK like I used to in the States, but when I do they can certainly hit the spot. One thing to be weary of is that even when ordering your burger medium, it is likely to come back to you quite pink. This has been consistent for me across all Byron visits - As I tend to order medium rare I was rather surprised by the almost raw burger put in front of me.  That being said, ambiance is good, service is quick and attentive and there are healthier options (like iceberg lettuce with blue cheese which really just strikes my fancy).  I'd say a good spot to bring visiting friends who may be pickier eaters. Drinks are also available across the range - from homemade lemonade, to craft beers, to some average to pretty good wine. Just be aware that ordering a number can get a bit pricey so hitting up on of the great local bars on Essex Road may be a better drinking option post-dinner (some of the better quality wines will get you at about 6/7 quid a drink).

QnJIpFCXjrDXa5PtEbbUVg.text: My favorite place for a burger in Islington. Mine involved bacon and spicy bbq sauce on a homemade bun. The meat was perfectly cooked, just a bit pink in the middle. I've been disappointed at one too many a burger joint in London, however Byron always comes through.As for the ambiance, most of the Yelp reviews are spot on---this place is the epitome of industrial chic meets a construction site. The interior is purposely left incomplete---exposed rafters, lighting/wiring. When upper street was under construction late this winter, it was hard to tell where the street construction ended and Byron began! But now the sidewalks are nicely polished and construction free. There are 2 or so sidewalk tables you can snag to enjoy your burger outside.If you're in the mood for a damn good burger, there really is no better place on Upper Street.

photos.caption: Photo of Byron - London, United Kingdom

IXbfCVv6R03c6NAwk4EO4w.text: Since I added Byron to my "to review" list, I've been again, which I guess is the benefit of being so far behind on my yelping.... Or I can keep telling myself.Anyway, back to Byron. Things I love about Byron:- burgers and fries a la carte- bowl of bacon in the window (makes my heart sing and my arteries cry)- A&W rootbeer floats- tasty local and craft beer and cider options- friendly, in fact outstandingly friendly, service- community support (ongoing Movember campaign)- amazing mac & cheese- skinny and veggie burger optionsBasically, Byron does burgers, nearly any way you might want them, to any way you might want it cooked with just about any combination of ingredients you can think of, in a cozy, eclectic, colorful environment that makes up for the traditional London-sized dent it's going to put in your credit card bill (so worth it!).

HKWb9eUJ3J5rsRiSWCf2uA.text: So Byron does burgers. However Byron burgers are not the best burgers, rather just basic burgers. I had the Byron burger which with bacon should elevate your basic burger to a beautiful burger, but it was still basic. Its flavor was a bit bare, as the Byron sauce wasn't a beautiful addition (although your basic ketchup and mustard helped). I didn't abhor the burger, it just wasn't any special. Coming from the states, it was definitely no In N Out burger (or even my favorite Santa Cruz local, Jack's). The price was a bit much for what you got as well. Pros: Onion rings were alright if a bit greasy. They had American mustard. I liked that they served the burger with a dill pickle on the side. I might go back. The blue cheese sauce had me intrigued. I wouldn't hurry back though. I'm not sure what the fascination with the place is, it really wasn't anything special.

EpxvUBX6i_jlnD5wdBhGLg.text: After arriving in London, getting a hamburger was not exactly my first choice. I wanted proper English food dammit. =PBut I was tired, and what else was open? My cousin recommended Byron's because he said the hamburgers were good. Walked into a cutesy hamburger joint. Bf ordered the Byron (bacon, cheddar and Byron sauce) and I ordered the skinny (burger w/o the bun). We topped it off with an order of fries and strawberry shake.I remember the burgers being a bit tiny and the side of fries being really small. But we thought, maybe this is how much the rest of the world eats. Americans are just greedy and fat. =P The burgers were juicy. I don't really remember any of the flavors being unique or outstanding. The fries and shake were decent was well. Overall, an ok meal. Pricey though. Total came out to around 20 pounds.

mVZ0n5cATElEhP4CAGnyhQ.text: The food and staff were brilliant, but the whole place looks like an old condemned fish and chip shop that has had loads of rickety wooden tables and chairs stuffed in it. I think the upstairs might be better (I spied another, larger seating area up there when popping to the loo), but the downstairs looks less like it hasn't been finished and more like nothing has actually even been started!

wP_o-ti9vVB5Z5w_lqPXbQ.text: Awesome burgers, friendly staff, relaxed atmosphere... What more do you want from lunch?

uYuKEso4eEirC3fUDKjBKg.text: Visiting from the land overflowing with burgers and fries, I have what you call... a refined burger palate.  Well, at least I try.  I went to Byron today for dinner since it was across the street from my hotel and I was craving a good ole' burger.  I have to say... it wasn't bad, but it still have some ways to go.The place was packed from corner to corner.  After waiting a few minutes, I was seated on a small wooden table.  I ordered the Byron lager (comes in a can), olives, Byron burger, and a side of onion rings.  The beer was eh, the olives were pretty good, and the onion rings were above average (good seasoning and nice clean break when you bite into it).  The Byron burger, the star attraction, looked better than it tasted.  The cheddar cheese was perfected melted, the buns well toasted and soft, and the veggies fresh.  My only gripe is with the meat and sauce.  The meat (they claim is ground fresh every day) was very tough and chewy... even though it was cooked medium rare.  I didn't think it was seasoned very well, if at all... and tasted very bland.  The 'byron sauce' was also nothing special.  It looked like runny watered-down thousand island dressing.  It didn't taste special either.  For those reasons, I had to give this place just three stars.  The corner In-N-Out, The Habit, Umami, or Five Guys burger in Cali puts this place to shame... and those are all chains. Sorry Byron... good try, but not quite there.

photos.caption: Photo of Byron - London, United Kingdom
Photo of Byron - London, United Kingdom
Photo of Byron - London, United Kingdom. The Byron with onion rings and olives.

-hS2J-a65UfK-iyBxBt2Kw.text: Staff are a bit hit or miss, but the burgers are juicy and actually have an actual resemblance to an actual American burger.  Of course you pay through the nose for the privilege, but sometimes you just need a bloody burger.  I think their fries are pretty good, but the ones at the kebab shop next door are better (if you happen to be getting your burger to go I'd get my chips there)  Personally, I like the BBQ bacon burger. Mu suggestion is sauce on the side otherwise the whole thing can get a bit soggy.  I hate Pizza Express, but at least the chain's gotten the food right this time even if the decor is trying a bit too had to be Dalston.One point docked for charging the equivalent of $16 for a burger without fries!

cPlJVsuZXfJOSOj0CtWaow.text: Byron is Byron. If you want to eat a good burger there is no other places !

photos.caption: Photo of Byron - London, United Kingdom

-1HTGN2L-p8JjDhqKm05EA.text: Even before I arrived in London, my friend kept insisting I go to Byron for a burger. Since it was right across the street from my hotel, I saved it for my last day in London (but not without an urgent reminder from my friend the night before). I ordered the tortilla chips with salsa and guacamole, the Byron burger (mmm, gotta love bacon, cheddar, and mystery burger sauce), and a lemonade. I've had better salsa and guacamole before, but the burger was incredible! Tip: Since I had a ton of salsa and guacamole left over, I smeared them into the burger which made it even more amazing.

WEi7_41zs5A4C9zBE7G1NQ.text: Should probably be a 3.5...But I am feeling generous as it is the season and all that.Have had many people rave about Byron (mainly Lloyd, s/o) and it was good - I had a huge beef burrito for lunch about 4 hours before so I wasn't rally hungry but stil went for their movember special welsh rarebit topped burger, the mrs had a bunless chicken burger and we split some onion rings. The burger was a perfect medium and the topping was nice, the bun was ovely and overall it told that the concept was sound - too many burger joints you end up eating the debris with utensils as the patty and bun collapse into nothingness under the stress of containing al the flavour/expectaions/condiments - not so here so a big score!Onion rings in really light batter were lovely and the chicken burger was good too. Friendly staff and very helpful. Brooklyn lager - reminisce about halcyon times in NY - so another plus point. Not sure about the décor as it is really forced, and the price was perhaps a few pounds more than reasonable but I wil b back to see if ti was just a fluke...

9a7L3fpNFltHzgWjQABN1w.text: I feel sorry for anyone who thinks its legitimate burger place ! The bun is completely dry and crumble to the touch of your hands . Worst burger I ever had!!!

mq6sGtlju-W-HokLNMLUsw.text: The macaroni cheese at this place is just like mum used to make.Which is a shame because, for all her wonderful qualities, my mum is a bit of a rubbish cook. And the mac'n'cheese at Byron genuinely is a lot like hers  - a thick layer of cheese on top, but otherwise shot through with flavourless, insipid white sauce.That said, the rest of the menu, insofar as I have experienced it, is superb. Juicy burgers, perfect fries and thick, decadent shakes. The waitstaff are uniformly charming and hot, to the degree that, last time we went, I had to talk my girlfriend out of leaving out waiter a 25% tip to "reward him for being so handsome" (her words).

brap01TJ2FdcELAfcWfUrw.text: Is this Byron as in Bay as in NSW Australia as in they know how to make damn fine hamburgers there and that's this joint's inspiration?Or is this Byron as is the kind of name they like to have as a first name in America, as in the globally recognised home to the BURGER and lover of beef?**I am torn, the between the Byron Burger and the Bourbon Burger... Aussie or Yank... what shall it be... Chips or fries...Down under you get sharp cheddar, beetroot, egg, bacon, carrot and avocado on your hamburger in addition to the usual lettuce tomato and oh of course beef.In the States however you get your decorative salad and seared patti smothered in spicy, smokey condiments vacuum-formed in viscus monterey-jack (this is a good thing if you were thinking it sounds like industrial manufacturing), it is also the only condition through which I will consume American cheese, and enjoy it.Quite pricey I have to say... but if you're going to spend the money on a burger, at least you'll enjoy it here. I can also recommend the frittered courgettes and the skins-on potatoes wedges as sides. Don't get a milkshake alongside your meal if you don't have a stomach the size of the Hoover Dam... they're extremely tasty but SO filling, as if the burger wasn't enough... I do find it hard to resist a root-beer-float though.Did not realise this was a franchise... that's a good thing right? I just love feeling like I'm sitting in the middle of a loft conversion upstairs... no really... a bit more gets completed every time I return. Can still see those floor boards though... oh wait that's the point. Have fun playing spot-the-cow figurines hidden about the place.Complaints- you don't get any sides included with your burger not even chips *gasp!*... which already costs around £9 so it's not a cheap roadway diner..._** I can tell you it certainly ISN'T Byron as in Lord Byron as in the 18th century English poet who probably never consumed anything as so much related to a juicy, flavoursome hamburger in his life...

uZa1BQO91_fz34HGgfc74A.text: Ok, so it's a burger chain, but it's a burger chain with a difference.  It's actually good. They keep it simple, fresh and it's just perfect.  Basics beef, chicken or vege with optional sides.  Love the slice of gherkin that comes with the burger - delish.  Their shakes are amazing.  And while the staff are cool, they're not too cool to serve you well. The look and feel is perfectly casual yet efficient. This is how you do hamburgers.  BOOM!

nFYPTRUrEwVEdgYJUGnVpQ.text: Great location and good service. The Byron burger is really good and great selection of brews.

O2JhyMQ4gE-pO_oCbUgxsQ.text: Consistently had pretty decent experiences at this Byron - the service is good and quick, but they tend to forget things on your order. I asked for my burger plain, but still received it with lettuce in, so a little annoying.Otherwise as far as Byron's go, this ones sizeable and in a convenient location

4foLLWQPTgIrDTsL3yehVQ.text: So I can have a really nice burger, with a side of really lovely macaroni cheese? Where do I need to go? Came here, a little merry after a few cocktails, thinking it didn't matter too much what I was eating, so we'd chance it with a chain, but to macdonalds as nandos is to KFC, it was not! I like to hate chains, but I can't hate Byron, a good choice of burgers, including veggie options, even a good choice of chips. They do specials, and they have a burger club too. The waiter was brilliant, and we had some great banter, and ribbing me over my tipsy state, and egging me on to try the alcoholic shakes, yes, alcoholic shakes. As a full on milkshake fiend (I have to have friends and loved ones guard the second half, forcing me to control myself and not inhale the whole thing), I can vouch for the shakes (even the chocolate ones) and the booze ones are a great great way to indulge. Definitely a good burger here!

sWOUu4fJ4zqF6Xx93gY7Zg.text: I regularly go here because the location is very near the two really good cinema's. I do love the outisde seats in summer and the decor of stripped laid back feel. But can't feel it is very small. Too small inside and cramped.That said the service whenever I have been has been excellent. Perfectly cooked burgers too. Go here to get my Byron Burger Club fix on Thursdays.

photos.caption: Photo of Byron - London, United Kingdom
Photo of Byron - London, United Kingdom

2AC3m9WUh6GiVKbYMx_BVg.text: Byron is a good chain that generally delivers a solid burger. Sure, it's not going to get burgerheads into a salivary frenzy, but for people who want a tasty burger that's not too much of anything, Byron is a good choice.The bad points:It's always a bit underseasoned - but I know how to use saltIt's a bit more than I'd like to spend (expect £15 a head, more if you want alcohol or dessert)Neutral:Their idea of medium is probably much more pink than your idea of medium - but it's firm and warm in the middle.I'm not keen on the decor. It's more OTT than other Byron branches and I wonder how it can ever be cleanThe burger is small (but for me, that's good, as I can't even finish it - but I recognise it's small).Good:A good texture to the meatFresh toppingsCourgette fries - really, I could live on these. I get Byron sauce to dip them inFriendly staffThe burger of the month always sounds amazing

wC-zYMAwA8t5sOEPcsSD7A.text: Dropped in for a snack: bacon cheese fries and a vanilla shake. The shake came out very quickly in its silver mixing cup. It was a large portion and very thick and flavorful. The fries came out a little later, served in a small mug-like pot with squirty cheese and bits of bacon on top. I would have liked more of each on the fries, but it was fine. Service was very friendly. Prices were ok. Interior was bright and clean. Glad I tried it, but I don't need to come back.

y_wUk6cMrTT_wxT6II9Z1A.text: Basic burger, no extras (£7).  All the parts were right, and came together nicely.  I suppose a quality patty has to cost.  Chips looked a little anemic for the price (£3), so I didn't bother. General atmosphere of the joint was pretty nice.  Would consider going back.

98W7BZGTjOnjP0-S-rowAA.text: Solid burgers. The least expensive red wine seemed to pair reasonably well with the Byron burger. Slightly disappointed that they would not do a rare burger; not sure if that's a thing with local laws or restaurant policy. That said, I had a medium rare burger which was more rare than most medium rare burgers I've had at home in the US. The bacon is American-style bacon but for me, a little lacking flavor. These are minor issues. All in all, a good, solid burger option.

mnczc-eUAkyuNezEe9aQTQ.text: I went here my first day back in London. After all that travel from the States, a burger was required -- and Byron didn't disappoint. We split the namesake burger, The Byron Burger. Bacon, onion, cheese... what's not to like?The staff was warm and friendly, especially the chipper Scottish girl who served us, along with another guy who I can't recall, but was lovely. I walk past here all the time now and often have to talk myself out of a burger, for fitness' sake, but mmm... burgers. Definitely will be going back!

b98F-TnhYG3UTPYkSb7_PA.text: I'm going on a burger hunt, and this was a pretty good choice. I had been wanting to try Byron for years, and now that I went once I've actually been two other times since, at two other locations - each time I've been impressed!The burger is great. I had their Byron burger twice, and it was delicious. I order mine medium rare and the second time at Covent Garden they definitely over-cooked it to medium, and friends who just took theirs medium said theirs was a bit overcooked as well. The Angel branch didn't have this problem. Either way both the Byrons were great, and everyone I was with really enjoyed theirs as well.The third time I went was near Kensington and they had a special burger with crispy fried onions and barbecue sauce on top - I can't remember what it was called, but oh dear LORD was it good! I highly recommend it if you go and it's the special that day.Oh and DEFINITELY get their fried courgettes. I forgo their chips for them every time and I never regret it. I also really like their beer selection, lots of American beers to choose from as well as a couple Brewdog choices, and a few others.I like that each branch has their own atmosphere. It makes each restaurant feel unique even if the food is exactly the same. So far I probably do like Angel one the best for atmosphere, but I'm a bit of a hipster who likes that wood-dominated kinda run-down look. The Covent Garden one is a bit more posh looking though so probably good for a date night, and the Kensington branch is very white and modern. The service is always decent, never out of this world but never bad.Is it the best burger in London? No, not really. But if it can make a score of Americans happy, then it's a good pick. Just make sure to order your burger cooked slightly less well than you normally like it and you should be happy!

photos.caption: Photo of Byron - London, United Kingdom. Smoky burger - delicious!

4Z1kHSyEPnkcZTYq3GGQYw.text: The place on Upper Street looks like it was taken over from squatters. But don't let that distract from the fact that this is a seriously delicious hamburger. Add a beer; what more do you need?

photos.caption: Photo of Byron - London, United Kingdom

oP_IfdpOgZtF7E7unMPq1w.text: I don't think I've ever posted a burger review on Yelp, which seems a sore oversight! I think it may have something to do with the fact that most of the burgers I have leave me a bit disappointed, I'm clearly not going to the right spots!The exception to this rule is Byron, which despite it's crazy expansion and generally boring everywhere-ness, really is that good. Shout out to the summer burger they have at the moment as well - the Sweet Caroline. Shoestring fries on my burger? Saves me the guilt of having to decide whether to order fries and oh so tasty to boot!The Islington outpost also has really great staff - the last couple times I've been in I've been very pleased with the friendlyness and care - they even charged my phone once - so yay to them.

BvAERU-eZJAIiSNP4wMiuw.text: When my family came to London to visit, my father noticed this place on the first night of his visit and made a mental bookmark to return. As requested, a few nights later we were in the mood for a quick dinner, close to the hotel. Byron seemed to fit the bill perfectly. Unfortunately, we were not impressed by the American style burgers. While I enjoyed the fixins on the burger I ordered, both my and my father's patties were woefully overcooked. The chips were floppy. My sister's salad was tasty but the quinoa was seriously undercooked and gritty. The waiter was slowslowslow and also somewhat snooty. He seemed frustrated that we only asked one order of chips and opted for tap water and nothing else to drink.All in all, the food wasn't horrific but it was definitely unremarkable and overpriced for what it was. With Five Guys across the street, I wouldn't come back.

M58A8qcDnGeaqvsOllalyg.text: Excellent burger place in the heart of Islington/Angel.Great service, even at a late hour, and they were very helpful with the menu options and getting the food made quickly.  The burger itself was very good, cooked as I requested, and worth the price.

4_P-lGn9H_nMn4xdaxhelA.text: I know, I know...Byron's burgers are the hype in London right now and I am very aware that I'm probably one of the few who actually didn't enjoy their dining-experince here. This Angel-Byron is really trying very hard to be cool; in my opinion, they've gone over-board with the currently all-so trendy "unfinished look": the walls are stripped barren, the cables are exposed and sitting on the upstairs gallery, you feel like you're in an attic or so. Granted, I like the unfnished look...but please keep it in moderation!As for the food, my burger was really just alright; nothing special. And the skin-on chunky fries were bland and lacked some salt (sure, I could add that, but they were so deep-fried that the salt didn't stick to them properly). I was also a little annoyed by the selection of wines. You could choose between: good, better, great and best. I mean, it is already nice that they want to help me with my decision-making, but I find it all to trivial, that the good one is the cheapest and the best one is the most expensive! All in all, my expectations were not met and I have no desire to try out any other Byron locations in the near future.

photos.caption: Photo of Byron - London, United Kingdom

Uglpri___JZs7WzLVJCSow.text: As an American, Byron is by far my favorite burger joint in London: their fries are perfectly skinny, they'll give me an extra pickle or two (if I ask nicely!), and the burgers are nothing fancy, just delicious. I don't need artisan buns or burgers stacked so high will fillings I can't wrap my mouth around ... Byron does away with all of this and just keeps things simple, which is why it's so (in my view) successful. I typically order the Byron cheeseburger with extra pickles (obvs) and fries. Staff are efficient and polite - I've never had a bad experience here. Quick turnover means that you don't have to wait long for a table. Highly recommended versus Five Guys just across the road.

jrhXegQFUny3Bls8O9HO5g.text: American Friends...BYRON HAS RANCH DRESSING!!! And it's delicious! I had it on the wedge salad tonight and just about died of the bliss. So yeah. You're welcome.

CNkda09tqARCztHBLaGRHQ.text: I give this place a thumbs up. The burgers were juicy, not overcooked, and had the right texture (key). They have several different types of burgers, many of them unique - making it tough to make a decision. Their fries were good too.We came in to the Islington location, attracted by the unique faux-rundown interior. We later saw that they had several locations across the city.

A6w5wpMZCsnlDNkT2aLfOg.text: On a busy Saturday night, we were able to get seated for 7 in 10 minutes and they even had a kids menu!  We were sat down and ordered a few beers and wine. I ordered the Tempranillo, which was juicy and yummy with our tortilla chips and guac/salsa. I have to say this guacamole was really good!A few of us ordered the Byron burger and the Byron with bacon, which looked good. And a few of us ordered the seasonal Hot a Doodle do, a chicken marinated in hot sauce, with crispy onions and a pickle, which I loved. I did add some of cholula sauce at the table cuz I like my spicy. I would not recommend the regular chicken burger -- dry, and not chockful of veggies like I would have hoped. The sides we got were fries and Mac n cheese, both good. Service was great, a nice change from what we had all weekend. I will come back but not just that one chicken burger!

Zjf1iB3VNrTPyUzbD9f5WQ.text: Don't judge a book by its cover, this place looks a little run down but the staff is so friendly and extremely attentive and the food is absolutely amazing. I would say one of the best burgers I have in any country I have visited and I've been all around the world. It's a diamond in the rough!
